item.title: M.2 PN532 NFC Module
item.description:
Overview

The M.2 PN532 NFC Module is a compact and versatile NFC/RFID reader/writer module in the popular M.2 form factor. Built around the NXP PN532 chipset, it supports multiple contactless communication protocols and is perfect for payment systems, access control, and IoT applications.

Key Features

  • PN532 Chipset: Industry-standard NFC controller
  • Multiple Protocols: ISO14443A/B, FeliCa, MIFARE
  • M.2 Interface: Standard M.2 Key-E connector
  • Read/Write Support: Full NFC tag read and write capabilities
  • Flexible Integration: Works with various M.2 host boards
  • Open Source: Complete documentation and examples

Specifications

  • Chipset: NXP PN532
  • Interface: M.2 Key-E (2230)
  • Protocols: ISO/IEC 14443 Type A/B, FeliCa, MIFARE Classic/Ultralight
  • Operating Frequency: 13.56 MHz
  • Communication: I2C, SPI, UART
  • Operating Voltage: 3.3V
  • Operating Range: Up to 5 cm
  • Dimensions: M.2 2230 (22 x 30 mm)

What’s Included

  • 1x M.2 PN532 NFC Module
  • Quick Start Guide
  • Online documentation access

Use Cases

  • Contactless payment terminals
  • Access control systems
  • Smart card readers
  • NFC tag programming
  • Product authentication
  • Data exchange applications

Getting Started

  1. Insert the module into an M.2 Key-E slot on your host board
  2. Install the required drivers and libraries
  3. Configure the communication interface (I2C/SPI/UART)
  4. Test with NFC tags or cards
  5. Integrate into your application

Resources

  • Documentation
  • Code Examples
  • Datasheet

item.title: Walkie-Talkie Module
item.description:
Overview

Pitaya Go is a compact, feature-rich IoT development board powered by the Nordic nRF52840 SoC. It’s designed for battery-powered IoT applications with built-in battery management and charging capabilities.

Key Features

  • Powerful SoC: Nordic nRF52840 with Bluetooth 5
  • Battery Ready: Built-in LiPo battery charger and management
  • Rich Peripherals: Multiple sensors and interfaces
  • Low Power: Optimized for battery-powered applications
  • USB-C: Modern USB-C connector for programming and charging
  • Compact Size: Perfect for portable projects

Specifications

  • SoC: Nordic nRF52840
  • CPU: ARM Cortex-M4F @ 64 MHz
  • Flash: 1 MB
  • RAM: 256 KB
  • Wireless: Bluetooth 5.0, Thread, Zigbee
  • Battery: LiPo charger (up to 500mA)
  • USB: USB-C (USB 2.0)
  • Sensors: Temperature, accelerometer, ambient light
  • Dimensions: 35 x 45 mm

What’s Included

  • 1x Pitaya Go Board
  • 1x USB-C Cable
  • Documentation & Examples
  • Plastic enclosure (optional)

Perfect For

  • Wearable devices
  • Environmental monitoring
  • Smart home sensors
  • Asset tracking
  • Portable IoT projects

Getting Started

  1. Connect Pitaya Go to your computer via USB-C
  2. Install the development environment
  3. Try the pre-loaded examples
  4. Add a LiPo battery for portable operation
  5. Build your IoT application

For detailed guides and examples, visit our documentation portal.

item.title: Moetes Development Environment
item.description:
Introduction

Setting up a development environment is crucial for efficiently creating and testing hardware products. At Moetes, we follow a structured approach to ensure our developers have the right tools and configurations to streamline the development process.

Choose the Right Platform

Selecting the appropriate platform is the first step. We typically use platforms like CircuitPython, Arduino, MicroPython, Raspberry Pi or custom development boards depending on the project requirements.

We will formally support the following platforms:

item.title: FAQs
item.description:
General Questions

What is Moetes?

Moetes specializes in developing and manufacturing IoT hardware modules and development boards. We provide high-quality solutions for wireless communication, NFC/RFID, and embedded systems.

Where can I purchase your products?

Our products are available through our official store and authorized distributors. Each product page includes a “Buy Now” button linking to purchasing options.

Do you offer technical support?

Yes, we provide comprehensive technical support for all our products. You can disscuss with us on GitHub or reach us through our contact page or via email.

item.title: Getting Started with IoT Development
item.description:
Modern IoT development hinges on two critical pillars: robust wireless connectivity and intuitive voice integration. This guide strips away the hype to focus on architecture, protocols, and engineering best practices.

1. IoT Architecture & Hardware Fundamentals

Core Layers

A functional IoT system operates on three distinct layers:

  • Device Layer: Sensors capture physical data; microcontrollers (MCUs) process it; actuators execute commands.
  • Network Layer: Communication modules transmit data via gateways or direct internet connections.
  • Application Layer: Cloud or edge servers process data for user interfaces and analytics.

Microcontroller Selection

The MCU is the engine of the device. Selection balances performance against power consumption.

item.title: About Us
item.description:
Moetes

Pronounced: Motes /moʊts/

We are defined by the fusion of fundamental physics and distributed connectivity. Our name is a deliberate synthesis of two core concepts:

Motes: Inspired by “Smart Dust”—tiny, distributed wireless sensor nodes that connect the physical world to the digital realm. This represents our expertise in creating pervasive, seamless wireless networks.

e (Electron): The fundamental subatomic particle that powers all electronics. It symbolizes the energy, precision, and hardware-level mastery that drives our innovations.

item.title: Contact Us
item.description:
Moetes is committed to helping you find the resources you need. If you need technical support, you can visit our docs or GitHub where we have technical support to assist you quickly. You can also check out FAQs for other questions.
